result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Molly M James

records.addlTxt:
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Murrufo
Defendant Molly M James in court.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Molly M James.

Defendant needs to complete an AODA Assessment and follow through to take advantage of the State's offer.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on January 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Molly M James
Current: 408 North West Avenue, Waukesha, WI 53186 United States  (Effective: 07-11-2022)
Prior: 165 State Street, Dousman, WI 53118
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Pre-trial conference on October 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

CONDITION MODIFIED ON 07/19/2022:  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store UNLESS for employment purposes only however can not comsume any alcohol.  

PREVIOUS CONDITIONS:
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with witnesses A & B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

02:11 PM Defendant Molly M James in court with attorney J Andrew Herbers.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court calls the matter for the Defense's Motion to Modify Conditions of Bond.
The State does not oppose the motion.
Attorney Herbers requests to modify bail.
The Court grants the Defense's motion.
Bail/bond hearing on July 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bail

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on October 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key. Signed by Judge Laura F. Lau on 7/11/22.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with witnesses A & B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

01:45 PM Defendant Molly M James in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern, Patrick Sicula.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared, Niki Kane for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  
The State places the offer on the record.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Per the State, can be set on the Pre-Trial Conference calendar.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
